Description: Two joining fragments (with 1924,1201.1162) of the foot and lower wall of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; interior: glazed black; exterior: single band above foot; fat rays above (on 1162); band on outer and inner face of foot; underside: central dot ringed by two concentric lines and one wide band; two lines nearer edge of underside; most of black is lost with only traces (fired brown) remaining, leaving the surface pale buff.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1162 and 1924,1201.1169.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.242) (phase 3)
